fields.summary: Run memcached by default using unix domain socket

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Memcached supports unix domain sockets, which when used will ensure the memcached daemon only listens on a unix socket with normal posix ACLs for local users only so there is no exposure to the network. This would alleviate the need for firewall rules to block the standard memcached TCP port from external traffic.

[Memcached Unix Sockets|https://code.google.com/p/memcached/wiki/NewConfiguringServer#Unix_Sockets]

Start the server with the '-s <socket file>' option. The client must know this filename but the standard FS perms on that file will allow only the 'eucalyptus' or 'eucaconsole' user to read/write to the socket.

This would give some security benefits while being minimally intrusive to the console client code.
fields.summary: Start memcached to listen only on unix domain socket, not network

comments.body: Sounds good to me, thanks [~zhill] and [~rusvika]!
[~jloza], can we target it for 4.2? It should not be a big change.
[~rusvika], it needs investigating, may not be possible. We are planning on adding it to Sprint 6 to see if it can be done, it hasn't fallen out of 4.2.

This works. By specifying this in the memcached config file:
OPTIONS="-s /var/run/memcached/memcached.sock -a 0766"

Also, location of the config file is not in /etc, it's in /etc/sysconfig

The console.ini setting to change is:
cache.memory.url = /var/run/memcached/memcached.sock

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1754

The only difference in this PR from the config I tested initially is locating the socket in /var/run/eucaconsole since this memcached is managed by the eucaconsole package.

There is an upgrade case to confirm here: if a console with memcached configured as follows is upgraded (cache.memory.url = 127.0.0.1:11211), will it continue working with that setting after upgrade to 4.3, including whatever upgrade of memcached takes place.

[~alice], [~ccassler]: Do you have another cloud I can verify the upgrade case with here?  I was going to make memcache-related config changes on our QA shared setup, but those changes (and the corresponding service restarts) proved too disruptive for folks.

Verified upgrade case on shared setup by modifying cache.memory.url setting to 127.0.0.1:11211 and restarting console process (and memcached).  Console and caching continues to work as expected.

Verified on: shared setup (region-one)
Console: https://g-05-03.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Account: kamalgill/admin
Tested on: Chrome (incognito mode) Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit)
Release: 0.9502.209.gitb005964.el7

[~gholms]: Do we need to consider the existing/upgrade case cache.memory.url = 127.0.0.1:11211 setting for our console SELinux policy in 4.3?
No.  The policy allows for that.
